metadata.Title: CVE-2018-10918 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description:
A null pointer dereference flaw was found in the way samba checked database outputs from the LDB database layer. An authenticated attacker could use this flaw to crash a samba server in an Active Directory Domain Controller configuration. Samba versions before 4.7.9 and 4.8.4 are vulnerable.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-10918` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libnss-winbind - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.14
libpam-smbpass - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.14
libpam-winbind - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.14
libparse-pidl-perl - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.14
libsmbclient - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.14
libsmbsharemodes0 - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.14
libwbclient0 - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.14
python-samba - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.14
registry-tools - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.14
samba - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.14
samba-common - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.14
samba-common-bin - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.14
samba-dsdb-modules - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.14
samba-libs - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.14
samba-testsuite - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.14
samba-vfs-modules - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.14
smbclient - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.14
winbind - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.14
No subscription required

criterions.comment: samba package in trusty, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.14.04.14').
